description:
Job Summary

The Transportation Manager is responsible for directing the CNG Bulk transport division including coordination of fleet maintenance, dispatching, employee management, safety, budgeting, and sales.

Benefits

CalPortland is proud to offer a comprehensive, competitive benefits package that provides health and financial support to our most important resources: our employees. Your benefits are an important part of your overall compensation at CalPortland. That’s why we give you a wide range of benefits to choose from.

  • Medical, Dental, Vision
    • low-cost premiums even for family coverage
  • Company-paid life/AD&D insurance
  • Company-paid short-term disability
  • Paid sick/vacation/holiday
  • 401k/Company Funded Pension Program (program is dependent upon location and job type)
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Additional voluntary benefits

Compensation

$90k-$110k

Responsibilities

  • Oversee daily operations CNG fleet operations
  • Promote safe work activities by conducting safety audits, leading and attending regular safety meetings, working closely with the safety manager, and recognizing key safety contributions
  • Adhere to all company policies, procedures, and business ethics and ensure that they are communicated and implemented within the team
  • Ensure compliance with all transportation regulatory issues
  • Responsible for Centralized Dispatch of bulk fleet orders for all deliveries to customers
  • Manage efficient usage of equipment and personnel for material deliveries
  • Prepare and monitor the annual sales/operations budget for the transportation business unit
  • Fleet metrics management and monthly reporting
  • Monthly P&L responsibility
  • Establish haul costs for internal and external bidding purposes; works with sales and billing to ensure proper rates and stand-by times are utilized and included
  • Work with the Equipment Manager and truck shops to keep an updated and well-maintained truck fleet
  • Responsible for handling any driver and service personnel after-hours accidents, issues, and concerns
  • Responsible for the hiring, training, and development of personnel
  • Work with sales on growth opportunities


Education

  • High school diploma/GED
  • Bachelor’s degree preferred


Requirements/Qualifications

  • Safety mentality
  • Three or more years coordinating people and resources in a construction materials environment, particularly working within or with the DOT
  • Knowledge of principles and methods for moving construction materials by truck, including relative costs, customer needs, efficient scheduling and safe operations
  • Must demonstrate strong business acumen
  • Salesmanship skills to attract and retain relationships with sub-haulers
  • Familiarity with scaling, bill prep and invoicing construction materials
  • Strong computer skills, i.e., Microsoft Suite, Excel, Outlook, Word and PowerPoint
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to motivate a team
  • Experience interviewing, selecting, and training people
  • Presentation skills
  • Critical thinking and decision-making under pressure


Preferred

  • College Degree in Transport and Logistics
  • Familiar with SAP


Conditions of Employment

Successful candidate must submit to a post-offer pre-employment physical examination, drug/alcohol screen, and background check. Some positions require Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration (FMCSA) registration/clearance as well as ongoing alcohol and drug testing.
